acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from ErC50=73.9mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality at this level (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of >5.5mg/L, together with the absence of mortality at this level (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: The available carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice provide no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 3 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=2.84(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 3.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro DNA repair tests and micronucleus tests in mice and rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)), though in vitro chromosome aberration tests showed positive.

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Cannot be classified, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; both trans- and cis- isomers are stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified; both trans- and cis- isomers are stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on test data from rabbit eye irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)): "Caused only mild irritation to the eye, which cleared up within 7 days."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on test data from rabbit skin irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)): "Caused mild irritation which persisted for up to 72 hours."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1997)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: No symptoms or signs referable to specific target organs were observed at dose levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2 in the available subacute toxicity studies in rats and dogs (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992, 1994)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including reduced locomotor activity, prone position, lacrimation, and blepharoptosis (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).
